results.title: Manyu-Wana 4 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Magic; spear-straightening in a fire and hunting for kangaroo; baby magic; words for ‘big’ and ‘little’ using different clothes being washed; collecting red ochre form a cave at Karrku, near Nyirrpi; working at the powerhouse; picking up rubbish; reading of “The Snake and the Goanna”; band magic; Nyirrpi tractor. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 3 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Children playing; dampers magic-number 6; exercising for health, showing football and basketball matches between communitites; spear-throwing at Yuendumu Sports; reading of “The Story about the Snake and the Mouse”; words for ‘heavy’ and ‘light’; colours; cleaning and grinding of bush seeds for seed cakes. Suitable for Primary, seconday and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with Englsih subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Working for the Yuendumu Mining Co.; reading of “The Story of the Perentie”; words for ‘far’ and ‘close’; cleaning teeth, washing eyes; fire-making; story about a little kangaroo looking for its mother; shirt magic; number 2. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 1 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This program contains the following topics: Magic; number 3; working as a stockman; reading of “The Man and the tree”; number 1; blowing noses; letter “M”; making hairstring; words for ‘wide’ and ‘narrow’; car magic; bat and ball magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Nature of healing
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description: This 6 part series draws upon the combined knowledge of Eastern and Western medicine, and reveals techniques and therapies to achieve true health and harmony. It will change the way life and health is perceived.

results.title: Biomagnetism
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
This program looks at magnetic field therapy, an approach much researched, particularly in Japan. Biomagnetic therapy combined with drug therapy has been used to successfully treat depression, dementia, non-healing fractures and spinal injuries.

results.title: Homeopathy
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Homoeopathy is a complementary medicine which is gradually gaining acceptance within traditional medicine. It is a therapy with a holistic approach, treating the causes rather than the symptoms of illness.

results.title: Touch
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Massage and touch therapies are commonly used to alleviate stress with steam baths together with massage a common therapy used in Japan and Hawaii. Aromatherapy, meditation, acupressure and reflexology are often combined to give holistic treatment to stress sufferers.

results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
The emphasis of acupuncture is on prevention rather than cure. First documented in ancient Chinese texts, acupuncture can be combined with other therapies to alleviate pain and is often used instead of anaesthesia. Cupping and acupressure use acupuncture techniques without the insertion of needles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images

results.title: Meditation
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Meditation is an ancient practice used to enhance enlightenment by altering metabolic processes to induce restfulness. Business people, patients and school students, in fact, everyone can benefit from the various therapies shwon if meditation is part of a daily routine.
